justification: "Dogmatism was measured by a 7-point Likert scale (Altemeyer, 2002) with 20-items."

measured_by: 12-item 6-point Personal Need for Structure Scale (Neuberg & Newsom, 1993)
justification: "Personal need for structure (Neuberg & Newsom, 1993) was measured by a 6-point Likert scale, with 12 items."

measured_by: Desire for Structure subscale of the Personal Need for Structure Scale
justification: "The PNS is further divided into two subscales: a desire for structure (liking structure and unambiguity)…"

measured_by: Reaction to Lack of Structure subscale of the Personal Need for Structure Scale
justification: "The PNS is further divided into two subscales… and a reaction to lack of structure (disliking the absence of structure)."

measured_by: Kullback–Leibler Distance (KLD) between sampled and true information distributions
justification: "Polarization… is measured by the Kullback-Leibler distance (KLD) between two probability distributions."
"We also quantified polarization as the degree of bimodality using the bimodality coefficient BMC."

measured_by: Variance Ratio of sampled information to true information
justification: "Extremeness is defined as the ratio of the variance of the information sampled by participants to the variance of the true information distribution."
